author: Puja Mehra
text:
The government is exploring the possibility for leveraging the assets under management of Life Insurance Corporation, Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation and the National Pension Scheme as part of the plans for recapitalising the public sector banks that have stressed balance sheets and are saddled with bad loans, a top official source said. Finance Minister Arun Jaitley could also make a small reference to the road map being planned.

The Economic Survey recommends that the assets of the RBI and other regulatory institutions be similarly used. Cross-holdings among banks could be considered later, the source said.
title: Govt. may leverage assets under LIC, EPFO
